comments.text:
1 failures in 831 pushes (0.001 failures/push) were associated with this bug in the last 7 days.

* mozilla-central: 1

Platform breakdown:
* windows10-64-ccov: 1

For more details, see:

comments.author: orangefactor@bots.tld

comments.text:
this has 3 failures in the last few days- it is odd because the jobs that failed typically run in <40 minutes and they randomly timeout and fail at 60 minutes.  In comparing a passing and failing log there are about 10% of the tests which take longer in the failure scenario, the ones that are >3 seconds longer in the failure scenario are:

this follows the same pattern, basically adding 18-21 seconds of runtime onto each test

for these above failures here is the logs

passing:
https://taskcluster-artifacts.net/Mx0K4LOnTWKkvyorR8GnXQ/0/public/logs/live_backing.log

failing:
https://taskcluster-artifacts.net/KzLA-qF2Tw642LOmRUHwag/0/public/logs/live_backing.log

I am not sure if there reasons for this- background processes, code updates, or internals of Firefox taking a while.  I would be curious to see what this looks like across many different builds.
comments.author: jmaher@mozilla.com

comments.text: in looking at 20 recent pushes for Frame-evalWithBindings-11.js, they all run in 2.6 seconds except for the 1 failure.  I think this is something random- maybe more data will help hilight the issue.
comments.author: jmaher@mozilla.com

comments.text:
These tests run in the js shell, not the browser. I can't think of anything within the JS engine that would cause this. Swapping maybe.

Not actionable now, setting P5.
